intro: Willemetia, commonly known as the ghost orchid, is a rare and elusive flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It is characterized by its lack of leaves and its unique, delicate white flowers that bloom in the summer. The plant thrives in wet, shaded environments, often growing on the trunks of trees in swampy areas. Willemetia has a symbiotic relationship with specific fungi, which help it absorb nutrients from the air and water. Due to habitat loss and its limited distribution, it is considered endangered and is protected in many regions.
